alert.note: Alert for Corson; Dewey (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued December 19 at 8:02PM MST until December 23 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST WEDNESDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH SATURDAY MORNING... ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH FRIDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 35 below zero. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 55 below zero. For the Winter Storm Watch, blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 45 mph. * WHERE...Corson and Dewey Counties. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Advisory, from 5 PM this afternoon to 5 PM MST Wednesday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Saturday morning. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Wednesday afternoon through Friday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
